channel.description: Latest Financial News for Google Inc.

item.title: Google: Facebook Overpaid For WhatsApp; Mobile Use Will Bring More Revenue Than PCs
item.description: [at Barrons.com] - Google's (GOOG) Chief Business Officer Nikesh Arora spoke about Facebook's (FB) $19 billion purchase of text-messaging firm WhatsApp last month, and he doesn't think that the social media giant got a bargain. Google, WSJ's Digits reports, had been in talks to purchase WhatsApp before the Facebook deal, although, it's unclear whether negotiations broke down years ago or in the past few months. Arona expressed skepticism about the price Facebook paid, asking "$500 million per employee? Is that a good use of our money?" (He was only slightly off, as the purchase price, divided by WhatsApp's 55 employees comes out to about $345 million per person.) Of course, Facebook is no stranger to high price tags—many people were concerned about the $1 billion it paid for photo-sharing firm Instagram, a deal that has since seemed to work in Facebook's favor.

Web TV pioneer KoldCast TV is shutting down after losing millions on original content
item.description: [paidContent.org] - KoldCast TV wanted to be "the other TV network," producing serialized original content and distributing it online. In the end, the numbers simply didn't add up.

item.title: Meet K-Glass: Korea's Answer to Google Glass
item.description: [at The Wall Street Journal] - As the hype surrounding wearable devices builds, a team of South Korean researchers from the country's top technology university claim they have developed an alternative to Google Glass: the K-Glass.
